Robot Mapper Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
RmUtility::BoundBoxSpecifies an upper-left and lower-right coordinates that identify a rectangular bounding box in a Cartesian coordinate system
CommandEncapsulates the elements that represent a single user command entered at the client terminal
RmUtility::CoordA Cartesian coordinate that is defined by an x and y component
RmExceptions::ExceptionProvides a base exception class that accepts an exception name, location, and message
RmExceptions::IndexOutOfBoundsExceptionIndicates an invalid index was provided when attempting to access an array
RmExceptions::InvalidDimensionExceptionIndicates a negative or otherwise disallowed value was provided when attempting to size or resize an array
RmExceptions::InvalidParameterExceptionIndicates an invalid parameter was provided
RmExceptions::InvalidStateExceptionIndicates an invalid parameter was provided
RmExceptions::IOExceptionIndicates an input/output error occurred when attempting a file operation
RmUtility::MappedSonarReadingProvides a means of representing a range reading in the context of a Cartesian coordinate system, where the robot, sonar, and range reading are all mapped to specific cooordinates
RmUtility::PoseProvides a standardized way of representing, accessing, and manipulating an object's pose, that is, its position on a Cartesian coordinate system and its heading
RmActionHandlerProvides an interface for any class that wants to act as an action listener within the Pioneer robot Aria event call chain
RmActionHookExtends Aria's ArAction so as to provide a means for hooking into the Pioneer robot event call chain
RmBayesCertaintyGridProvides a Cartesian-based certainty grid that utilizes a Bayesian probabilisitc sonar model
RmBayesSonarModelProvides Bayesian probabilistic model for interpreting sonar readings
RmClientProvides a UDP socket client for wireless data transfer
RmGlobalMapProvides the mechanism for Bayesian probabilistic mapping of sonar readings into a collection of RmLocalMap objects, performing real-time localization on them, and integrating them into a single global map
RmGlobalMap::RegionA region identifies an area of the global map that is uniquely covered by one or more local maps
RmLocalMapBuilds on the dynamic occupancy grid provided by RmBayesCertaintyGrid by adding functionality particular to the notion of a local map, namely the ability to shift and rotate a map within a global frame of reference
RmMutableCartesianGrid< T >Builds upon the dynamically resizable two-dimensional matrix functionality of RmMutableMatrix, wrapping around it the notion of a four-quadrant Cartesian coordinate system, or grid
RmMutableMatrix< T >Overcomes the static nature of built-in C++ two-dimenionsional arrays by providing an stl::vector<T>-based two-dimensional matrix that can be dynamically declared and resized at run-time
RmMutableMatrix< T >::Operator2D< T >Provides mechanism for achieving a two-dimensional operator[] shorthand, such as in my2dArray[x][y]
RmPioneerControllerProvides a wrapper around and interface to a ActivMedia Robotics Pioneer P2AT mobile robot and its accompanying Aria robot control API
RmPolygonProvides polygon functions, such as intersection, difference, and union
RmServerProvides a UDP socket server for wireless data transfer
RmSettingsAggregates all configurable settings within the application
RmSettings::MotionModelStructParameters for configuring the motion model used for localization
RmSonarMapProvides a virtual superclass that defines a standard interface for a sonar-based occupancy grid map
RmSonarMapperProcesses sonar range readings as they are received from a Pioneer robot or simulator, mapping them to a RmSonarMap and recording them to file
RmExceptions::SocketExceptionIndicates an input/output error occurred when attempting a file operation
RmUtility::SonarReadingProvides a platform-independent means of representing all pertinent data in a sonar range reading
